Article Title: IPS officer suicide: High Court seeks probe report, details of accused
Article Text:
.

IPS Officer 'Suicide': Wife Seeks FIR Against Haryana DGP, Rohtak SP Over 'Harassment And Abetment'

CHANDIGARH: Punjab and Haryana HC Monday ordered Chandigarh administration to submit a status report and details of the accused in the investigation into the suicide of senior Haryana IPS officer Y Puran Kumar.A bench headed by Chief Justice Sheel Nagu passed the directions while hearing a PIL seeking a CBI investigation into the case. "What is the status of the investigation, as it has been almost a month since registration of FIR? Where has the investigation reached, and who all have been named as accused?" HC asked. It sought these details by Thursday.During Monday's hearing, petitioner Navneet Kumar from Ludhiana reiterated his concern that an officer named in the FIR was currently heading Panchkula district, raising fears he could influence the probe. He pointed out that no arrests had been made, and no officer had yet joined the investigation.The petitioner argued that a senior officer's suicide due to alleged harassment undermined public confidence.
Article Summary: Punjab and Haryana HC ordered Chandigarh administration to submit a status report and details of the accused in the investigation into the suicide of senior IPS officer Y Puran Kumar. A bench headed by Chief Justice Sheel Nagu passed the directions while hearing a PIL seeking a CBI investigation.

Article Title: NIA seeks in-camera hearing in Yasin case
Article Text:
.

NEW DELHI: NIA on Monday urged Delhi HC to conduct in-camera hearings on its plea seeking the death penalty for Jammu and Kashmir Liberation Front chief Yasin Malik in a 2017 terror-funding case, citing national security concerns.HC posted the matter for further hearing on Jan 28. Malik is serving a life term in Tihar Jail in the case after a sessions court convicted him in 2022.
Article Summary: NIA urges Delhi HC to conduct in-camera hearings on its plea seeking the death penalty for Jammu and Kashmir Liberation Front chief Yasin Malik. Malik is serving a life term in Tihar Jail in the case after a sessions court convicted him in 2022.

Article Title: EC hits back after Tejashwi's bias claim
Article Text:
.

After RJD neta Tejashwi Yadav questioned EC for having deployed over 20,000 policemen from BJP-governed states for poll duty in Bihar, EC clarified that state armed police component constitutes only 20% of total forces deployed."Nearly 80% of police forces are deployed from the central armed police forces and only 20% of forces are deployed from the state armed police, which are drawn proportionately from different states as per their availability," said an official from EC.SAP personnel on duty in Bihar have been taken from 24 different states, including oppn-governed Jharkhand, Kerala Telangana, Punjab, Himachal Pradesh and Karnataka.On Tejashwi's criticism of EC for not disclosing genderwise turnout for Phase 1 polling, EC officials insisted that relevant figure was "generally given at the time of final turnout".
Article Summary: RJD neta Tejashwi Yadav questioned EC for having deployed over 20,000 policemen from BJP-governed states for poll duty in Bihar. EC clarified that state armed police component constitutes only 20% of total forces deployed. Nearly 80% of police forces are deployed from the central armed police forces.

Article Title: Case against VHP man 'diluted' after outfit's neta meets Pilibhit DM & SP
Article Text:
.

PILIBHIT: Days after VHP's regional organisation in-charge Prince Gaur was arrested on Nov 8 under charges of "forgery, extortion and criminal intimidation" for allegedly demanding money from Pilibhit ADM (finance and revenue) Ritu Punia, police Monday "dropped serious charges" from the FIR.These charges carried punishments ranging from 10 years prison to life and also prevented release on bail through district-level courts. Police move purportedly came after VHP's state organisation minister, Rajesh, met the DM and SP, and warned of a "huge protest".Notably, an FIR was registered initially under BNS sections 132 (2), 336 (3), 338, 340 (2), 308 (5) and 351 (2). Of these, the accused could be sentenced to life under BNS section 338, while he could be convicted with imprisonment for 10 years under BNS 308 (5). On Monday, the cops "replaced" section 308 (5) - having a provision of a 10-year sentence - with section 308 (4) that confines the imprisonment to a maximum seven years, and "dropped" sections 338, 336 (3) and 340 (2) from the FIR.Gaur's lawyer Ashwani Agnihotri told TOI: "Satish Kumar, the investigating officer in Gaur's case filed his report to the CJM's court, confirming the removal of certain BNS sections and modification in one of them."The ADM had filed an FIR against Gaur in Pilibhit's Kotwali thana on Nov 6. In her complaint, she stated: "Gaur levelled allegations against me for imposing excessive fine in a stamp duty evasion case along with enforcing legal action under section 80 of UP Revenue Code in a matter associated with the development of a residential colony, apart from intimidating a few persons linked with the development project."Regarding section 80, the Additional District Magistrate pointed out that the powers of execution under this section were vested with the SDM, while the city magistrate was the designated administrative officer for the regulated area to deal with development of colonies. "But Gaur intentionally dragged my name into all these irrelevant matters with the intent to only harass and defame me. Gaur demanded extortion money as well," the ADM claimed.Pilibhit DM Gyanendra Singh said, "We have asked the VHP state functionary to give in writing whatever objections he had regarding the enforcement of legal proceedings against Prince Gaur. We shall take steps in a fair and transparent manner as per the law." ASP Vikram Dahiya added, "Yes, we're aware of the matter. FIR was registered based on a written complaint of a senior administrative officer; the case is under investigation. .."Meanwhile, VHP functionary Rajesh said, "The main motive behind the FIR was to hide the ADM's misdeeds and some of the charges levelled by Gaur. We want a probe to be held on Gaur's complaint and truth should finally come out."
Article Summary: Prince Gaur was arrested on Nov 8 under charges of "forgery, extortion and criminal intimidation" He allegedly demanded money from Pilibhit ADM (finance and revenue) Ritu Punia. Police move purportedly came after VHP's state organisation minister, Rajesh, met the DM and SP, and warned of a "huge protest"

Article Title: Delhi blast: CCTV footage shows suspect’s vehicle entering and exiting Red Fort area; over 100 clips being examined
Article Text:
CCTV footage shows suspect’s vehicle entering and exiting red fort area



Terror Angle in Delhi Blast Not Ruled Out: PM Modi Briefed, Home Minister Amit Shah Calls NIA, NSG





NEW DELHI: At least eight people were killed and many injured in a high-intensity explosion near Delhi's Red Fort on Monday evening at 7 pm, when a blast occurred in a Hyundai i20 car at the Subhash Marg traffic signal.Delhi Police have obtained CCTV footage showing a lone suspect's car entering and exiting the parking area and are now investigating the incident, according to news agency ANI.The Delhi Police are examining over 100 CCTV clips, including footage from nearby toll plazas, to track the vehicle's complete movement as investigators trace the route towards Daryaganj.Police have registered a case at the Kotwali Police Station under various sections of the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA), the Explosives Act, and the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita."This evening, around 7 pm, a blast occurred in a Hyundai i20 car at the Subhash Marg traffic signal near the Red Fort in Delhi. The blast injured some pedestrians and damaged some vehicles. Preliminary reports indicate that some people have lost their lives. Within 10 minutes of receiving the information of the blast, teams from the Delhi Crime Branch and Delhi Special Branch arrived at the spot," Union Home Minister Amit Shah said.Shah further stated: "I have also spoken to the Delhi CP and the Special Branch in charge. The Delhi CP and the Special Branch in-charge are present at the spot. We are exploring all possibilities and will conduct a thorough investigation, taking all possibilities into account. All options will be investigated immediately and we will present the results to the public."Delhi Police Commissioner Satish Golcha provided details about the incident: "Today, at around 6.52 pm, a slow-moving vehicle stopped at the red light. An explosion happened in that vehicle, and due to the explosion, nearby vehicles were also damaged. All agencies, FSL, NIA, are here... Some people have died, and some have been injured in the incident. The situation is being monitored."The blast damaged several vehicles in the vicinity and affected pedestrians near the Red Fort Metro Station area.Multiple investigative agencies, including the Forensic Science Laboratory (FSL) and National Investigation Agency (NIA), are present at the blast site.The authorities are reviewing surveillance footage to establish the complete sequence of events and movement of the suspect's vehicle.Special Branch and Crime Branch teams reached the location within 10 minutes of receiving information about the explosion.The investigation is currently exploring all possible angles of the incident, with authorities promising to share findings with the public.
Article Summary: At least eight people killed and many injured in a high-intensity explosion near Delhi's Red Fort on Monday evening. Delhi Police have obtained CCTV footage showing a lone suspect's car entering and exiting the parking area. Police are examining over 100 CCTV clips, including footage from nearby toll plazas.

Article Title: Raja Raghuvanshi murder case: Trial to begin in Shillong court today; wife Sonam, paramour among accused
Article Text: SHILLONG: The trial into the murder case of Indore-based businessman Raja Raghuvanshi is scheduled to begin in the district and sessions court here on Tuesday.The court had framed charges of murder, criminal conspiracy, and causing disappearance of evidence under provisions of the BNS, 2023, on Oct 28 against the accused, including Raja’s wife Sonam, her alleged paramour Raj Kushwaha, and three alleged hired killers from Madhya Pradesh — Vishal Singh Chauhan, Akash Rajput, and Anand Kurmi.All the five prime accused are currently in judicial custody here while three other co-accused — property dealer Silome James, Lokendra Tomar, the owner of the building where Sonam was hiding after Raja’s murder, and security guard Balbir Ahirbar — are on conditional bail.Raja, who was on honeymoon with Sonam at Sohra, was allegedly killed at the behest of his wife on May 23.The SIT, constituted by the Meghalaya Police to probe into the murder, had retrieved the body of Raghuvanshi from a deep gorge near Wei Sawdong Waterfall at Sohra on June 2.The SIT had filed a 790-page chargesheet against all the accused in the court of judicial magistrate (first class), Sohra sub-division on Sept 5.
Article Summary: The trial into the murder case of Indore-based businessman Raja Raghuvanshi is scheduled to begin in the district and sessions court here on Tuesday. The court had framed charges of murder, criminal conspiracy, and causing disappearance of evidence under provisions of the BNS, 2023, on Oct 28 against the accused.
